# Acutrack Design System - Assets Guide

## Overview

The Acutrack Design System includes a comprehensive set of logo assets and favicon files that developers can use in their applications. All assets are properly bundled and accessible through the npm package.

## Available Assets

### Logo Assets

The design system provides multiple logo variants optimized for different themes and use cases:

#### **Full Logos**
- `acutrack-logo-light.svg` - Full logo for light themes
- `acutrack-logo-dark.svg` - Full logo for dark themes
- `acutrack-logo.svg` - Default full logo

#### **Icon Logos**
- `acutrack-logo-icon-light.svg` - Icon-only version for light themes
- `acutrack-logo-icon-dark.svg` - Icon-only version for dark themes

#### **Grey Variants**
- `acutrack-grey-light.svg` - Grey full logo for light themes
- `acutrack-grey-icon-light.svg` - Grey icon for light themes
- `acutrack-grey-dark.svg` - Grey full logo for dark themes
- `acutrack-grey-icon-dark.svg` - Grey icon for dark themes

### Favicon & Web App Assets

Complete favicon and web app manifest assets for PWA support:

- `favicon.ico` - Traditional favicon
- `favicon.svg` - Modern SVG favicon
- `favicon-96x96.png` - PNG favicon (96x96)
- `apple-touch-icon.png` - Apple touch icon
- `web-app-manifest-192x192.png` - PWA icon (192x192)
- `web-app-manifest-512x512.png` - PWA icon (512x512)
- `site.webmanifest` - Web app manifest

## Usage Methods

### Method 1: Import Logo URLs (Recommended)

```tsx
import { 
  LOGO_URLS, 
  ACUTRACK_LOGO_LIGHT, 
  ACUTRACK_LOGO_DARK,
  ACUTRACK_LOGO_ICON_LIGHT,
  ACUTRACK_LOGO_ICON_DARK 
} from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Use structured logo URLs
function Header() {
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState('light');
  
  return (
    <header>
      <img 
        src={theme === 'light' ? LOGO_URLS.light.full : LOGO_URLS.dark.full}
        alt="Acutrack Logo"
        className="h-8"
      />
    </header>
  );
}

// Use individual logo URLs
function Sidebar() {
  return (
    <aside>
      <img 
        src={ACUTRACK_LOGO_ICON_LIGHT}
        alt="Acutrack"
        className="h-6 w-6"
      />
    </aside>
  );
}
```

### Method 2: Direct Asset Import

```tsx
// Import specific logo files
import logoLight from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/acutrack-logo-light.svg';
import logoDark from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/acutrack-logo-dark.svg';
import favicon from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg';

function App() {
  return (
    <div>
      <img src={logoLight} alt="Acutrack Logo" />
      <link rel="icon" href={favicon} />
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Method 3: Copy Assets to Public Directory

```bash
# Copy assets to your public directory
cp node_modules/@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/assets/* public/
```

Then reference them in your HTML:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico" />
  <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg" />
  <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/apple-touch-icon.png" />
  <link rel="manifest" href="/site.webmanifest" />
</head>
<body>
  <img src="/acutrack-logo-light.svg" alt="Acutrack Logo" />
</body>
</html>
```

## Integration with Components

### Header Component Integration

```tsx
import { Header, LOGO_URLS } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function App() {
  return (
    <Header
      variant="website"
      theme="brand"
      logoUrl={LOGO_URLS.light.full}
      logoAlt="Acutrack Logo"
      hasThemeToggle={true}
      navigationItems={[
        { href: '/home', label: 'Home' },
        { href: '/about', label: 'About' }
      ]}
    />
  );
}
```

### Sidebar Component Integration

```tsx
import { Sidebar, LOGO_URLS } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function App() {
  return (
    <Sidebar
      variant="default"
      theme="brand"
      logoUrl={LOGO_URLS.light.icon}
      logoAlt="Acutrack"
      navigationGroups={[
        {
          title: 'Main',
          icon: <Icon>home</Icon>,
          items: [
            { href: '/dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: <Icon>dashboard</Icon> }
          ]
        }
      ]}
    />
  );
}
```

## Theme-Aware Logo Usage

### Automatic Theme Detection

```tsx
import { LOGO_URLS } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function ThemeAwareLogo() {
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState('light');
  
  const logoSrc = theme === 'light' 
    ? LOGO_URLS.light.full 
    : LOGO_URLS.dark.full;
    
  return (
    <img 
      src={logoSrc}
      alt="Acutrack Logo"
      className="h-8 transition-opacity duration-200"
    />
  );
}
```

### CSS-Based Theme Switching

```css
/* CSS custom properties for theme-aware logos */
.logo {
  content: url('@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/acutrack-logo-light.svg');
}

.dark .logo {
  content: url('@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/acutrack-logo-dark.svg');
}
```

```tsx
function CSSThemeLogo() {
  return (
    <div className="logo h-8 w-auto" />
  );
}
```

## Favicon Implementation

### HTML Head Implementation

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <!-- Traditional favicon -->
  <link rel="icon" href="@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.ico" />
  
  <!-- Modern SVG favicon -->
  <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg" />
  
  <!-- Apple touch icon -->
  <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/apple-touch-icon.png" />
  
  <!-- Web app manifest -->
  <link rel="manifest" href="@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/site.webmanifest" />
</head>
</html>
```

### Dynamic Favicon Switching

```tsx
import { useEffect } from 'react';

function useFavicon(theme: 'light' | 'dark') {
  useEffect(() => {
    const favicon = document.querySelector('link[rel="icon"]') as HTMLLinkElement;
    if (favicon) {
      favicon.href = theme === 'light' 
        ? '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg'
        : '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg';
    }
  }, [theme]);
}

function App() {
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState('light');
  useFavicon(theme);
  
  return (
    <div>
      {/* Your app content */}
    </div>
  );
}
```

## PWA Integration

### Web App Manifest

The included `site.webmanifest` provides PWA configuration:

```json
{
  "name": "Your App Name",
  "short_name": "YourApp",
  "description": "Your app description",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#ffffff",
  "theme_color": "#FF6B35",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/web-app-manifest-192x192.png",
      "sizes": "192x192",
      "type": "image/png"
    },
    {
      "src": "@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/web-app-manifest-512x512.png",
      "sizes": "512x512",
      "type": "image/png"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Best Practices

### 1. Logo Sizing
```tsx
// Use appropriate sizing classes
<img 
  src={LOGO_URLS.light.full}
  alt="Acutrack Logo"
  className="h-6 w-auto" // Maintain aspect ratio
/>
```

### 2. Accessibility
```tsx
// Always include alt text
<img 
  src={LOGO_URLS.light.full}
  alt="Acutrack Logo"
  className="h-8"
/>

// For decorative logos
<img 
  src={LOGO_URLS.light.icon}
  alt=""
  role="presentation"
  className="h-6"
/>
```

### 3. Performance
```tsx
// Preload critical logos
<link 
  rel="preload" 
  href="@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/acutrack-logo-light.svg" 
  as="image" 
/>

// Use appropriate formats
// SVG for scalable logos
// PNG for complex graphics
// ICO for favicons
```

### 4. Theme Consistency
```tsx
// Ensure logo matches your theme
const logoSrc = theme === 'light' 
  ? LOGO_URLS.light.full 
  : LOGO_URLS.dark.full;

// Use grey variants for subtle branding
const subtleLogoSrc = LOGO_URLS.grey.light.full;
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

1. **Assets not loading**: Ensure you're using the correct import path
2. **Theme mismatch**: Verify you're using the correct logo variant for your theme
3. **Favicon not showing**: Check browser cache and ensure proper HTML implementation
4. **PWA icons not working**: Verify manifest file is properly configured

### Debug Tips

```tsx
// Log available logo URLs
console.log('Available logos:', LOGO_URLS);

// Check if assets are accessible
fetch('@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg')
  .then(response => console.log('Favicon accessible:', response.ok))
  .catch(error => console.error('Favicon error:', error));
```

### Layout Issues Root Cause Analysis

**Common Problem**: Components not displaying properly or layout inconsistencies.

**Root Cause Analysis Method**:

1. **Identify the Issue**:
   - Component not visible
   - Layout misalignment
   - Responsive behavior problems
   - Styling inconsistencies

2. **Check Implementation vs Design System**:
   ```tsx
   // ❌ PROBLEMATIC - Custom CSS overrides
   <div className="max-w-md mx-auto">  // Custom container
     <Card variant="elevated" size="lg">  // Design system component (working fine)
       // Form content
     </Card>
   </div>

   // ✅ CORRECT - Using design system Grid
   <Grid cols={{ xs: 1, lg: 2 }} gap={6}>  // Design system component
     <Card variant="elevated" size="lg">  // Design system component
       // Form content
     </Card>
   </Grid>
   ```

3. **Component Performance Analysis**:
   | Component | Status | Issue Source |
   |-----------|--------|--------------|
   | `Grid` | ✅ Perfect | Not used initially |
   | `Card` | ✅ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Input` | ✅ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Button` | ✅ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Container` | ✅ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | **Custom Layout Code** | ❌ Problem | **Implementation mistake** |

4. **Solution Strategy**:
   - **Remove custom CSS**: Eliminate custom containers and styling
   - **Use design system components**: Leverage Grid, Container, and other layout components
   - **Follow established patterns**: Use the same structure as working forms/components
   - **Test responsiveness**: Ensure proper behavior across all screen sizes

5. **Prevention Tips**:
   - Always use design system components for layout
   - Avoid custom CSS overrides
   - Follow established patterns from working examples
   - Test on multiple screen sizes
   - Use the design system's responsive utilities

**Key Takeaway**: Our design system components work perfectly when used correctly. Layout issues are typically caused by custom implementation choices that conflict with the design system's intended usage patterns.

## Asset Specifications

### Logo Dimensions
- **Full Logo**: Optimized for header use (recommended height: 32px)
- **Icon Logo**: Square format (recommended size: 24x24px to 32x32px)
- **Format**: SVG for scalability and performance

### Favicon Specifications
- **favicon.ico**: 16x16, 32x32, 48x48 multi-size
- **favicon.svg**: Scalable vector format
- **Apple Touch Icon**: 180x180px
- **PWA Icons**: 192x192px and 512x512px

---

*This guide covers all aspects of using Acutrack Design System assets in your applications. For more information about specific components, refer to the component documentation.*
